abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Rice Development
            Project for Guinea was satisfactory. The project achieved
            its main objectives, its impact has been significant on
            agricultural development, and both the Bank and Borrower
            performed satisfactorily. Several lessons can be learned
            from this project. First, the project demonstrated to the
            Government that a smallholder orientation was a more
            effective and less costly approach to development than
            collectives or state farmers. Second, the project's
            success can be attributed to the particular attention paid
            to avoiding parallel organizational structures. Third, the
            project was able to successfully test simple technical
            packages that promoted low cost yield improvements by using
            simple technology such as improved seed, fertilizer, simple
            water control, and crop husbandry improvements. Finally, IDA
            supervision in the areas of accounting, financial
            management, and credit recovery was weak since supervision
            efforts concentrated on technical and administrative matters.

docna.cdata!:
Guinea - Rice Development Project : Credit
            0952 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Guinea - Rice Development Project
            : Credit 0952 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
Over five years the project would assist
            the Guinean Government to develop its rice sector. Through
            its national component the project would: (a) strengthen the
            Ministry of Agriculture by establishing a specialized unit
            for the planning and coordination of the country's rice
            development program including consultant assistance and
            fellowship funds for the training of Guinean cadres; (b)
            upgrade the country's agronomic rice research in order
            to provide a testing and demonstration capacity for
            introducing technical improvements; (c) undertake a pricing
            study to assist Government to restructure agricultural
            prices so as to provide appropriate incentives to its rural
            sector; and (d) prepare for a future agricultural
            development project in Upper Guinea. The project also
            contains a regional component, a pilot project to be carried
            out in Guinea's Forest Region to test and develop
            technical improvements to rice cultivation practices of
            farmers. If the pilot operation is a success, it would
            constitute the basis for a follow-up project in that area.

PROJET DE DEVELOPPEMENT DE LA
            RIZICULTURE - GUINEE

abstracts.cdata!:
Over five years the Rice Development
            Project will assist the Guinean Government to develop its
            rice sector. Through its national component the project
            will: (a) strengthen the ministry of agriculture by
            establishing a specialized unit for the planning and
            coordination of the country's rice development program
            including consultant assistance and fellowship funds for the
            training of Guinean cadres; (b) upgrade the country's
            agronomic rice research in order to provide a testing and
            demonstration capacity for introducing technical
            improvements; (c) undertake a pricing study to assist
            Government to restructure agricultural prices so as to
            provide appropriate incentives to its rural sector; and (d)
            prepare for a future agricultural development project in
            Upper Guinea. The project also contains a regional
            component, a pilot project to be carried out in
            Guinea's forest region to test and develop technical
            improvements to rice cultivation practices of farmers. If
            the pilot operation is a success, it will constitute the
            basis for a follow-up project in that area.
